activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#3528
activity.text:
### What's new?

Adds `ImageWithFallback` component and utilised for facility cover image when an image cannot be retrieved.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/195767882-6d0a13c5-0227-43fb-8ec6-f23421179e1e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/195767912-42e2e0b1-be66-4916-9d7a-8c7b92dabacf.png)

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#3742
activity.text:
@khavinshankar definitely!! Could you help tailwind the async autocomplete field in the https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/pull/3744 patient filters?

Generally, apart from that, I was thinking of having all the input components have their own validators and also be compliant with form reducers across care since we mostly have only `set_form` and `set_error` only.

so that, the component's API interface would just take in the additional props (validator, reducerProps) [see this](https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/pull/3744/files#diff-2c391d69e3a85e37959e9843913cba1d1db5aa23dac46c81625b168a38c78d9cR18-R29).

however, the components API should still be usable when not used with reducers.
So I was just taking time to document it clearly so that it's easily maintainable by everyone and changing the component API interface later would be a hassle.

For example, the text input is composed like this:
https://github.com/coronasafe/care_fe/pull/3744/files#diff-e0e39dd41cb8f0b76d60275fa706cd765c8648107e45183f24781aa0cd51145f
and when used with reducers, the amount of code we write would be so less, but still, it'll render out the errors and field labels without having to write separate components each time.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2286
activity.text:
@gigincg 

None of the breaking changes seems to effect our usage. Tested deploy too and everything seems to work, no issues due to axios bump found yet.



List of breaking changes from axios releases between the above versions

> - Distinguish request and response data types (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4116)
> - Change never type to unknown (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4142)
> - Fixed TransitionalOptions typings (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4147)
> - Revert: change type of AxiosResponse to any, please read lengthy discussion here: (https://github.com/axios/axios/issues/4141) pull request: (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4186)
> - Fixing maxBodyLength enforcement (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3786)
> - Don't rely on strict mode behaviour for arguments (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3470)
> - Adding error handling when missing url (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3791)
> - Update isAbsoluteURL.js removing escaping of non-special characters (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3809)
> - Use native Array.isArray() in utils.js (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3836)
> - Adding error handling inside stream end callback (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3967)
> - New toFormData helper function that allows the implementor to pass an object and allow axios to convert it to FormData (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3757)
> - Removed functionality that removed the the Content-Type request header when passing FormData (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3785)
> - (*) Refactored error handling implementing AxiosError as a constructor, this is a large change to error handling on the whole (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/3645)
> - Separated responsibility for FormData instantiation between transformRequest and toFormData (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4470)
> - (*) Improved and fixed multiple issues with FormData support (https://github.com/axios/axios/pull/4448)

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2543
activity.text:
@gigincg @anuran-roy Vercel preview deploy works without clearing cache out of the box for this PR. 
However netlify preview build failed 3 times even after clearing cache.

[Build logs](https://app.netlify.com/sites/care-net/deploys/62a4a77f19201b00093b79a1#L13) says: 

```
8:03:16 PM: Different build command detected, going to use the one specified in the Netlify
configuration file: 'CI='' yarn run build' versus 'CI="" yarn run prebuild && CI="" yarn run
build || { cat /tmp/* ; sleep 30 ; false; }' in the Netlify UI
```

activity.title: coronasafe/care#792
activity.text:
@iamsdas I'm using the staging API via proxy mentioned in `care_fe/package.json`

I'm yet to setup a local care BE on my machine.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/171849660-749941b9-314e-494f-b7df-696037c63ac8.png)

- What I'm performing is:
```sh
curl 'https://careapi.coronasafe.in/api/v1/asset/' \
        -X POST \
        -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:100.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/100.0' \
        -H 'Accept: application/json, text/plain, */*' \
        -H 'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' \
        -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br' \
        -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
        -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJ0b2tlbl90eXBlIjoiYWNjZXNzIiwiZXhwIjoxNjU0MjU4MjY5LCJqdGkiOiIwZjgyMTQ5Mzc4MjY0ZWUyYTJmNzVlNDFmYzllMmRjMSIsInVzZXJfaWQiOjIwMn0.gp1grpzzKDH3ZCPoRSI_XTLX-IoZnWDATUcZQpolwuU' \

{
  "name": "Hello Asset :wave:",

  "is_working": "true",
  "not_working_reason": "",

  }
}'
```

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2381
activity.text: Feature: Keyboard Shortcuts for Camera Live Feed

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2160
activity.text:
@gigincg I'm thinking of taking this up.

Two approaches can be there.

### 1. Client Side
Where each preset is traversed and selected at an interval controlled by the client side.
However in this method the middleware will not be aware whether a client is using patrol mode or not, and hence other clients who might access the same camera will also not be aware of this. Set preset requests may conflict the order if more than one client accesses it.

### 2. Server side
An endpoint for the camera can be exposed to enable patrol mode, and also status response can include whether the resource is in patrol mode or not. Hence every client will be aware whether it's in patrol mode or not. Presets are traversed and selected by the middleware/backend, hence order is maintained regardless of multiple clients accessing the resource. Preset traverse interval can be optionally adjusted by client.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2381
activity.text: Feature: Keyboard Shortcuts for Camera Live Feed

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2374
activity.text:
- [ ] `Ctrl` + `Up`: Move Camera Up
- [ ] `Ctrl` + `Left`: Move Camera Left
- [ ] `Ctrl` + `Down`: Move Camera Down
- [ ] `Ctrl` + `Right`: Move Camera Right
- [ ] `Alt` + `S`: Save / Update Preset
- [ ] `Alt` + `X`: Stop feed
- [ ] `Alt` + `R`: Reset Feed
- [ ] `Alt` + `+`: Zoom In
- [ ] `Alt` + `-`: Zoom Out
- [ ] `F`: Enter full-screen (Exit full-screen shortcut is handled by browser itself)

Any suggestions? @gigincg

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#2374
activity.text: Feature: Keyboard Shortcuts for Camera Live Feed
